definitions.definition: To move ; to be shifted from a fixed position.
examples: I’ve been pushing this rock as hard as I can, but it won’t budge an inch.

definitions.definition: To move; to shift from a fixed position.
examples: I’ve been pushing this rock as hard as I can, but I can’t budge it.

definitions.definition: To yield in one’s opinions or beliefs .
examples: The Minister for Finance refused to budge on the new economic rules.

definitions.definition: To cut or butt (in line); to join the front or middle rather than the back of a queue.
examples: Hey, no budging ! Don't budge in line!
definitions.label_groups: Upper Midwestern US , Indiana , western Canada

definitions.definition: To try to improve the spot of a decision on a sports field.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move ; to be shifted from a fixed position.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To move; to shift from a fixed position.
To yield in one’s opinions or beliefs .
( Upper Midwestern US , Indiana , western Canada ) To cut or butt (in line); to join the front or middle rather than the back of a queue.
To try to improve the spot of a decision on a sports field.
